instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_KBDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_KBDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_KBDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the keyboard backlight. When this is low or missing, the keyboard will not light up..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no LCD/ KBD backlight   2015 LCD Screen Compatibilty
threads.message:
Hi team,

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that was supposed to have a liquid damage, but when i opened it this one was very clean, no liquid traces, all water pads are white.
here are the 2 symptoms:
It always turns ON ( chime, display ) but sometimes the fan doesn't spin, i did a SMC reset but no changes.
I have no lcd and kbd backlight but i have <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> at 50V and <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_KBDBKLT</SIGNAL> at 5V which means that there is no load ( screen backlight not detected ) as Louis explained it here [url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/1145-macbook-air-no-backlight-troubleshooting-guide[/url].

I wanted to know which macbook screens are compatible, because I've tried good screen coming from a 2012 retina but I have no display/backlight at all.
Should I only respect the manufactured year whatever it's an Air or Pro or should it be the exact same model?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no LCD/ KBD backlight   2015 LCD Screen Compatibilty
threads.message:
1. The fan only spins on this model when the CPU gets warm. Not an issue just a stupid feature.
2. The ONLY LCD that will work with the 4924 is a 2015 13" display. 2013/14 will have picture with no backlight. Must be the 2015 screen. 
3. Keyboard backlight I have no idea. Tried another keyboard backlight?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no LCD/ KBD backlight   2015 LCD Screen Compatibilty
threads.message: If you have 50V then you have the correct LCD. Pin 1 on the connector or cable is probably damaged. Could also be inside the LCD but that is more rare. Inspect connector and cable first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no LCD/ KBD backlight   2015 LCD Screen Compatibilty
threads.message:
Hi Dukefawks,
Once again you got it: it was the cable, pins 1 & 2 disconnected, also visually pin 1 didn't look good at all but on the connector at the LCD side, I mean in the LCD assembly.
Now backlight ok, I'm posting with it now.
But regarding the fan, I've installed Macs Fan Control and forced it to a constant speed but the fan doesn't spin, and the app reports speed at 0 as feedback.
Fan is controlled by the smc through the <CHIP>U5870</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5871</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5872</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5873</TRANSISTOR>, right?
Could you please quickly explain me how is it working, just wanna make sure I don't miss something.
Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no LCD/ KBD backlight   2015 LCD Screen Compatibilty
threads.message: Fan does not spin until it gets hot. This machine is fine now.
